Since X suffers a shock of S on its capital, and X has a capital of P, then X is in default.
Since DL is in default, and DL has an amount of VL long-term debts with C, then C is at risk, having a total of EL of TL term exposures to defaulted debtors.
Since C is at risk, having a total of E of T term exposures to defaulted debtors, then C has a total debt of B.
Since C has a total debt of B, and C has a capital of R, then C is in default.

X has suffered a shock on its capital, resulting in default. This has put C, who has VL long-term debts with X, at risk, with a total of EL of TL term exposures to defaulted debtors. As a result, C has a total debt of B and is now in default, with a capital of R.

X has suffered a shock to its capital, causing it to default. This has put C, who has VS of short-term debt exposure to X, at risk, with E of T term debt exposure to defaulted debtors. C has a total debt of B and a capital of R, meaning it is also in default.

X is in default due to a shock of S to its capital. C is at risk, having a total of E of T term exposures to defaulted debtors: ES of TS from DS and EL of TL from DL. C has a total debt of B and a capital of R, so it is also in default.
X has defaulted due to a shock of S on its capital, resulting in a capital of P.
Since DL is in default, C is at risk, having a total of EL of TL term exposures to defaulted debtors. This puts C's total debt at B, and with a capital of R, C is now also in default.
C has a total debt of B and is at risk due to having ES of TS term exposures to defaulted debtors. With a capital of R, C is in default.

C is at risk having a total of E of T term exposures to defaulted debtors, with DS and DL in default and having VS and VL short- and long-term debts respectively. C has a total debt of B and a capital of R, meaning it is also in default.
